comments.body: This would be great I want more biomes to explore and especially the new blocks and plants. Minecraft needs more cool plants :)
that boss might be too OP

How about this instead of being a 4th dimenstion or a new biome in the overworld would be the new biome in the End. It suits the end perfectly, and this way Mojang can knock out 2 good reqests in one update.

Dr. Thezbi Kazo.

This is really cool. I had also been thinking about this. I think a mob that would be cool is some sort of a giant angler fish really deep where it's dark would be cool. It would be able to swallow the player whole and then spit the player back out, doing 3 hearts of damage. And if you hit it's light enough it breaks and the angler fish dies. Then you would get some sort of powerful item.
Interesting ideas. You have my vote.
I think there should be a new ocean depths biome (basically deep deep ocean) where the new boss you mention spawns, love the rest of your ideas!
yes lack of tropical fish and it feels so boring

I agree with you. I think Mojang didn't go far enough in the Aquatic Update. Be careful! This update is huge but incomplete.

A boss? Why not the Kraken?

Oceans that benefit from the Cliff Update with sea trenches that go down to -50 blocks.

I think Mojang should add shells. We can loot nautilus, why don't we see any swimming? It would be nice to have nautilus that swim. I do see sharks... but be careful, most shark species are harmless to humans.

I hope I helped you :)

“Heat & Hail” or “Summer & Winter” Update. Could add a Christmas-esque music disk & “snowflake” trim.

That’s A good idea. But They Added Sniffer but they will add penguins

PLEASE MOJANG!! Ive spent years building in this biome JUST becasue of the color. My whole base doesnt looks completely different and i havnt opened it again since this update :(
Please mojang
I think instead of a Soul Flint and steel it could be an "Echo Flint and steel" or something along those lines. This is a pretty cool idea!
I think the dimension should be called the other Side.
Sounds great.
I love this idea and want it added so much!
sure why not it's a great idea!
Umm infected hoglin? Since it looks like the mold infects mobs who wander in it, its fair to say the hoglins are pretty stupid and wandered over

Yeah good point actually, will just need to figure out a mechanic for them, could be similar to the infected piglin. I also wanted to perhaps maybe add a feature to the mold that touching it damages you and gives the block animation like its trying to get inside the player and infect it, to really make the feel of this biome being alive. This of course could add a new potion into the mix to prevent taking damage by the mold which could be called potion of purity. Could be an enchantment added to any armour instead too.
is it worth going there in the first place? how good is the valuable block

Whilst i havent figured out a proper use for the mold spore block, i would definitely like to give it many beneficial uses considering how dangerous it would be to obtain it. There is also the mold eye that’s extremely valuable for redstone uses, as its a redstone block that detects motion. Along with the mold tendrils and jaw that can be used for good base defences. Would also plan on adding another structure in the living cavity called the Infested Barracks that could host great loot such as maybe netherite gear (see Infested Barracks Post).

Maybe another cool feature to make the living cavity feel more alive is that when too many spore blocks are mined, the living cavity gurgles and then summons mold tendril blocks from the ground that attack, to make it as if the biome is trying to protect its spore eggs.

That is a good point, or maybe there could be a setting in-game to turn off seasons, similar to how I said if they added falling leaves, it would be a good idea to make it optional for how far away you will see them generate or to just turn them off all together, in case your device isn't all too good. The idea of having separate biome variants for each season also sounds good though, so that you could have better blending between biomes, so if there is a cold biome like a snowy taiga next to a normal forest, the forest could be a snowy winter forest which then transitions into a fall forest the farther away you get, then a summer forest, then a spring forest. Either one of these ideas could work.

I think crops in seasons could be protected by putting magma blocks around the crops, but I think seasons should change instead of winter biomes and summer biomes, fall and spring should be in Minecraft. It dose not feel right without spring and fall but winter and summer.
Good idea!
Yeah, if it's only going to be the swamp changes, then the "Wild Update" sounds like a broad theme. Might as well be the Wild Swamp Update or the Muddy Update.

i have been asking for this since before 1.19 was announced, but perhaps this would put too much stress on mojang. think about all the mobs and blocks. termites, meerkats, ostridges, palm trees, coconut trees, vultures, prickily pears, iceologer, moobloom, glare, copper golem, copper buttons and that's only if you don't include unannounced items or the original vote.

Seems like an interesting concept, perhaps nautilus shells could also be found in the sand in the shallows if you use a brush (the brush itself was announced with archeology in the caves and cliffs update for those wondering.)

I think that this is a great idea as it could add a lot of color and variation to minecraft. It could be like the beaches off of like figi or something with clear water and lots of vibrant wildlife. There could also be a unique sand block that can shift around over time and reveal some type of loot very rarely.
I like it. When the palm trees arrive, they can go here.
This biome will include hermit crabs, crabs, sea slugs, seabirds and seahorses.
